channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CASSANDRA-11431] java: error: unmappable character for encoding ASCII
item.description:
I saw this closed issue with the exact same signature as the one I encountered, so cloning... I fixed the errors below by adding the line "<compilerarg line="-encoding utf-8"/>" after lines 727 and 1089 of the cassandra/build.xml file. I am working PerfKitBenchmarker, so the workload must build on my platform (ppc64) without any changes after cloning it from github. Thanks!

item.summary: java: error: unmappable character for encoding ASCII

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Github user mlpesant commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/cassandra/pull/65#issuecomment-200555378

Moved this request to JIRA https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-3754

roger.meier, I am trying to create a patch but I don't seem to be able to generate one. Is there something I'm missing? I sent a push request for this yesterday but I'm not sure if that's enough. Thanks!

mlpesant@tul65p1:~$ git clone http://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/cassandra.git cassandra
Cloning into 'cassandra'...
remote: Counting objects: 254781, done.

Receiving objects: 26% (66688/254781), 7.16 MiB | 631.00 KiB/s

remote: Total 254781 (delta 151792), reused 248687 (delta 146885)
Receiving objects: 100% (254781/254781), 127.19 MiB | 1.13 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (151792/151792), done.
Checking connectivity... done.
mlpesant@tul65p1:~$ cd cassandra
mlpesant@tul65p1:~/cassandra$ git checkout cassandra-2.1.10
Note: checking out 'cassandra-2.1.10'.

You are in 'detached HEAD' state. You can look around, make experimental
changes and commit them, and you can discard any commits you make in this
state without impacting any branches by performing another checkout.

If you want to create a new branch to retain commits you create, you may
do so (now or later) by using -b with the checkout command again. Example:

git checkout -b <new-branch-name>

HEAD is now at 78f2e7a... bump version
mlpesant@tul65p1:~/cassandra$ git checkout -b THRIFT-3754-2.1.10
Switched to a new branch 'THRIFT-3754-2.1.10'
mlpesant@tul65p1:~/cassandra$ vi build.xml
mlpesant@tul65p1:~/cassandra$ git add build.xml
mlpesant@tul65p1:~/cassandra$ git commit -m 'Fix bug THRIFT-3754'
[detached HEAD 5178a35] Fix bug THRIFT-3754
1 file changed, 2 insertions
mlpesant@tul65p1:~/cassandra$ git format-patch --stdout > test.txt
mlpesant@tul65p1:~/cassandra$ ls -l test.txt
rw-rw-r- 1 mlpesant mlpesant 0 Mar 24 16:16 test.txt

Have the same build issue when the default encoding is not UTF-8.
The patch is available to set the file encoding to UTF-8. Please review.

On the other hand, the non-ASCII characters in source code are typos we should fix:

    [javac] Compiling 1273 source files to /home/zjay/ws/cassandra/build/classes/main
    [javac] /home/zjay/ws/cassandra/src/java/org/apache/cassandra/db/ColumnFamilyStoreCQLHelper.java:2: error: unmappable character for encoding ASCII

Stefania could you please review the patch?

Thanks for the patch. I think this problem should be fixed by CASSANDRA-11077, we just need to backport it to 3.0. Could you test it since I am unable to reproduce the problem?

I've also added an additional commit with the fix for the tabs in build.xml, and the typo in ColumnFamilyStoreCQLHelper:

3.0
patch
testall

Backported CASSANDRA-11077 to 3.0 as d98446ede1ff786109577ebe9187a84cdea48f40 and committed the fix for the typo and tabs as 15b52809f2f10a37a753a7d6734e71f7c3dc521d, then merged upwards.

Let us know if you still have problems jay.zhuang. I'm pretty sure CASSANDRA-11077 should have fixed the problem, but I could not reproduce it locally or on Jenkins.
